document.docAuthor: Xue, Xiao-Feng, Cheng, Li-Sheng & Hong, Xiao-Yue
document.docTitle: Paracaridilophus retusus Xue, Cheng & Hong, 2011, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Eriophyoid mites from Hainan Province, China III: Descriptions of three new genera and three new species of Colomerini (Acari: Eriophyoidea)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Eriophyoid mites from Hainan Province, China III: Descriptions of three new genera and three new species of Colomerini (Acari: Eriophyoidea)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Description. FEMALE: (n = 8 , dorsal view) Body fusiform, 110 ( 110–145 ), 40 ( 40–43 ) wide; light yellow. Gnathosoma 13 ( 11–13 ), projecting obliquely down, pedipalp coxal seta ( ep ) 2 ( 2–3 ), dorsal pedipalp genual seta ( d ) 4 ( 4–5 ), simple, cheliceral stylets 10 ( 10–11 ). Prodorsal shield 32 ( 32–33 ), 35 ( 35–37 ) wide, median and admedian lines parallel and encircled by a large “cell”; submedian lines incomplete and concaved at center forming two lateral bulges; anterior shield lobe, broad. Scapular tubercles ahead of rear shield margin, 4 ( 3–4 ), 3 ( 3–4 ) apart, scapular setae ( sc ) 11 ( 10–11 ), projecting posteriorly and centrad. Coxal plates with granules, anterolateral setae on coxisternum І (
1 b
) 7 ( 7–8 ), 6 ( 6–7 ) apart, proximal setae on coxisternum І (
1 a
) 11 ( 11–13 ), 10 ( 10–11 ) apart, proximal setae on coxisternum І (
2 a
) 17 ( 17–19 ), 18 ( 17–18 ) apart. Prosternal apodeme absent. Legs with usual series of setae. Leg
І 17
( 17–18 ), femur 4 ( 4–5 ), basiventral femoral seta ( bv ) 5 ( 5–6 ); genu 2 ( 2–3 ), antaxial genual seta ( l'' ) 15 ( 15–17 ); tibia 3 ( 2–3 ), paraxial tibial seta ( l' ) 15 ( 15–16 ), located at center, tarsus 3 ( 2–3 ), seta ft' 11 ( 11–12 ), seta ft'' 12 ( 11–12 ), seta u' 2 ( 2–3 ), tarsal empodium ( em ) 5 ( 5–6 ), simple, 6 -rayed, tarsal solenidion (ω) 6 ( 5–6 ), rod-like. Leg
І 18
( 17–18 ), femur 4 ( 3–4 ), basiventral femoral seta ( bv ) 8 ( 7–8 ); genu 2 ( 2–3 ), antaxial genual seta ( l'' ) 5 ( 4–5 ); tibia 3 ( 2–3 ); tarsus 4 ( 3–4 ), seta ft' 5 ( 5–6 ), seta ft'' 11 ( 10–11 ), seta u' 2 ( 2–3 ), tarsal empodium ( em ) 5 ( 4–5 ), simple, 6 -rayed, tarsal solenidion (ω) 6 ( 5–6 ), rod-like. Opisthosoma : opisthosoma dorsally with 26 ( 25– 27 ) annuli, with a wide furrow, dorsal annuli with filamentous microtubercles on rear annular margins; ventrally with 40 ( 40–42 ) annuli, with filamentous microtubercles on rear annular margins. Setae
c 2
28 ( 27–28 ) on ventral annulus 4 ( 4–5 ), 34 ( 34–36 ) apart; setae d 32 ( 30–33 ) on ventral annulus 14 ( 13–14 ), 28 ( 25–28 ) apart; setae e 13 ( 13–15 ) on ventral annulus 22 ( 20–22 ), 9 ( 8–9 ) apart, setae f 15 ( 15–17 ) on 6 th ventral annulus from rear, 13 ( 13– 15 ) apart. Setae
h 1
absent,
h 2
16 ( 16–18 ). Female genitalia 9 ( 9–10 ), 15 ( 14–15 ) wide, coverflap with many short lines, setae
3a 6
( 5–6 ), 11 ( 11–12 ) apart.

MALE: (n = 1 , dorsal view) Body fusiform, 107, 45 wide; light yellow. Gnathosoma 13 , projecting obliquely down, pedipalp coxal seta ( ep ) 2 , dorsal pedipalp genual seta ( d ) 3 , cheliceral stylets 11 . Prodorsal shield 36, 40 wide. Scapular tubercles ahead of rear shield margin, 3, 4 apart, scapular setae ( sc ) 10 , projecting posteriorly and centrad. Coxal plates with granules, anterolateral setae on coxisternum І (
1 b
) 6, 9 apart, proximal setae on coxisternum І (
1 a
) 10, 12 apart, proximal setae on coxisternum І (
2 a
) 15, 24 apart. Prosternal apodeme absent. Legs with usual series of setae. Leg
І 18
, femur 4 , basiventral femoral seta ( bv ) 5 ; genu 3 , antaxial genual seta ( l'' ) 16 ; tibia 3 , paraxial tibial seta ( l' ) 7 , located at center, tarsus 5 , seta ft' 12 , seta ft'' 13 , seta u' 2 , tarsal empodium ( em ) 6 , simple, 6 -rayed, tarsal solenidion (ω) 6 , rod-like. Leg
І 17
, femur 4 , basiventral femoral seta ( bv ) 10 ; genu 2 , antaxial genual seta ( l'' ) 5 ; tibia 3 ; tarsus 5 , seta ft' 6 , seta ft'' 15 , seta u' 2 , tarsal empodium ( em ) 6 , simple, 6 -rayed, tarsal solenidion (ω) 6 , rod-like. Opisthosoma : opisthosoma dorsally with 32 annuli, with a wide furrow, dorsal annuli with filamentous microtubercles on rear annular margins; ventrally with 35 annuli, with filamentous microtubercles on rear annular margins. Setae
c 2
26 on ventral annulus 3, 41 apart; setae d 38 on ventral annulus 9, 32 apart; setae e 8 on ventral annulus 18, 12 apart, setae f 20 on 6 th ventral annulus from rear, 15 apart. Setae
h 1
absent,
h 2
17 . Female genitalia 9, 15 wide, setae
3a 6, 14
apart.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material. Holotype
, female (slide number NJAUAcariEriQ 94 , marked Holotype ), from
Fissistigma retusum (Lévl.) Rehd.
( Annonaceae ), Bawangling Nature Reserve, Changjiang County, Hainan Province, P.R. China , 19 °07ʹ03ʹʹN, 109 °09ʹ02ʹʹE, elevation 650m ,
30 September 2008
, coll. Xiao-Feng Xue, Zi-Wei Song & Zhen Wang.
Paratypes
,
7 females
and
1 male
(slide number NJAUAcariEriQ 94 ), with the same data as holotype .
Relation to host. Vagrant on leaf surface. No damage to the host was observed.

Etymology. The specific designation
retusus
is from the species name of host plant,
retusum
.
